title: Silent Movie Week at MoMA
description: The Museum of Modern Art presents its third annual silent movie week, featuring seven recently restored silent films from 1923-28. The series opens with Walter Ruttmann’s 'Berlin: Symphony of a City'.

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Captain America: Brave New World
description: Enjoy free outdoor movies at Rainey Park (LIC) featuring 'Captain America: Brave New World'.

title: Jazz at Pier 84
description: Jazz up your evening with the Jazz Foundation of America's free outdoor concerts at Hudson River Park's Pier 84 (Hell’s Kitchen).
address: Hudson River Park, Pier 84, Hell’s Kitchen

title: Fightin’ Words! A Language Game Show
description: Three contestants compete in a series of word-based games to win the ultimate prize: a new word of their creation will be added to the people’s lexicon.

title: Happy Birthday, Kate: A Kate Bush Party
description: DJ Bright Light Bright Light’s annual dance party celebrating all things Kate Bush returns to C’mon Everybody (Bed-Stuy).

title: Wagner Park Reopening
description: After a two-year closure for resiliency improvements, downtown's Wagner Park reopens to the public. The 3.5-acre waterfront space will host a lineup of free events through October, kicking off with an outdoor performance by Taylor Mac.

title: Lincoln Center’s Fourth Annual Summer for the City
description: Lincoln Center's annual arts festival brings two months of free and choose-what-you-pay music concerts, performances, dance parties, film screenings, and more to its Upper West Side campus.

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Elf and Party Girl
description: Enjoy free outdoor movies at Domino Park (Williamsburg) featuring 'Elf' and 'Party Girl'.

title: Letters + Sodas: LIC Reading Series
description: Writer Lana Schwartz brings together comedians and writers for a night of standup, humor pieces, fiction, and essay readings at The Greats of Craft (LIC).

title: NYC Magic Ensemble
description: Expect the unexpected as the NYC Magic Ensemble presents a night of magicians and mentalists at Young Ethel’s (South Slope).

title: Live at the Gantries
description: Kupferberg Center for the Arts presents Live at the Gantries, an annual outdoor concert series at Gantry Plaza State Park (LIC) showcasing local artists. Tonight: Afro-Colombian ensemble Rebolú.

title: Rooftop Films: New York Non-Fiction 2025
description: The popular rooftop films series returns for its 29th season. Tonight: Jessica Earnshaw’s 'Baby Doe' at the Old American Can Factory (Gowanus), followed by filmmaker discussion and a reception.

title: Live Band Karaoke at Arlene’s Grocery
description: Choose from a wide assortment of rock and pop songs and take the stage with your very own live band (Nakatomi5) backing you up at Arlene’s Grocery (LES).
